availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Garland Carter (Louisville Dry Goods Merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant. Simpson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Melvilla Brown Carter in LaRue County, Kentucky, on June 5, 1855. Father of Edwin L. Carter, Allen R. Carter, and James G. Carter, Jr. Merchant in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 45.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 53.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, LaRue County Marriages, Film 000409559.
"Merchant and Christian," The Courier Journal (Louisville, KY), December 18, 1889, p. 6.
"James Garland Carter, Sr. (1825-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial 83020668, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83020668 (accessed May 11, 2017).
